page.title: 03Ponthirwaun-Capel Tygwydd
page.content: Chapel & Vestry. Ponthirwau is a tiny community with a conregational chapel whch seats about one hundred people. It has about twenty five members who attend on regular basis. The Minister is in charge of three chapels altogether and lives in Newcastle Emlyn. There is also a vestry which is the focal centre for the social ife of the community. The vestry is used also when the electors of the Prish of llandygwydd go to vote in local and parliamentary elections. Capel Tygwyy. Llandygwydd Church as a small missionary church in Capel Tygwydd where the Llandygwydd curate used to be in charge. There are about eighten members there now, and they have a service twice a month taken by the Vicar of Llandygwydd.
